page.title: 10St Rumbold's Well
page.content: King's Sutton had a spring which became famous as a spa. That is a place where people met and drank the good water. The water in King's Sutton was high in magnesium which was good for healing. The water does not look very healthy now. By the road to Charlton you can still see St Rumbold's Well but it would not be used for drinking any more because the water is all orange and has lumps of flaky stuff in it. I think it would make you ill rather than better. Quite a few people came to King's Sutton at one time to drink the water, but Bath, Cheltenham and Leamington soon became more popular.
